clusters.neutral_headline: Man Dies in Shark Attack on Sydney's Northern Beaches

items.title: ‘A great tragedy’: man dies in shark attack near Dee Why on Sydney’s northern beaches
items.standfirst: Beaches from Manly to Narrabeen closed after death of 57-year-old who leaves behind wife and childGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastA man has died near Dee Why on Sydney’s northern beaches after being bitten by what is believed to be a large shark, in what police have called “a great tragedy”.Shortly after 10am on Saturday, New South Wales emergency services were called to Long Reef beach following reports a man had suffered critical injuries. Continue reading...
items.content: Beaches from Manly to Narrabeen closed after death of 57-year-old who leaves behind wife and childGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastA man has died near Dee Why on Sydney’s northern beaches after being bitten by what is believed to be a large shark, in what police have called “a great tragedy”.Shortly after 10am on Saturday, New South Wales emergency services were called to Long Reef beach following reports a man had suffered critical injuries. Continue reading...

items.title: Experienced surfer and dad dies in shark attack on Sydney's Northern Beaches
items.standfirst: A 57-year-old man has died after being attacked by what police are describing as a large shark on Sydney's Northern Beaches on Saturday morning.
items.content: A 57-year-old man has died after being attacked by what police are describing as a large shark on Sydney's Northern Beaches on Saturday morning.

ai_summary: A fifty-seven-year-old man died after a shark attack near Dee Why beach.

Police described the event as a great tragedy.
Beaches from Manly to Narrabeen were closed following the attack.
The victim was an experienced surfer and father.
